options.name: Create
options.description: Provision a new certificate

options.name: Delete
options.description: Delete a certificate

options.name: Download
options.description: Download a certificate

options.name: Get
options.description: Retrieve a certificate

options.name: Get Many
options.description: Retrieve many certificates

options.name: Renew
options.description: Renew a certificate

properties.name: PolicyDN
properties.description: The folder DN for the new certificate. If the value is missing, the folder name is the system default. If no system default is configured

properties.name: Subject
properties.description: The Common Name field for the certificate Subject (DN)

options.name: Approvers
options.description: An array of one or more identities for certificate workflow approvers

options.name: CADN
options.description: Only required when no policy sets a CA template. The Distinguished Name (DN) of the Trust Protection Platform Certificate Authority Template object for enrolling the certificate.

options.name: CertificateType
Code Signing
options.description: X.509 Code Signing Certificate

options.name: Device
options.description: X.509 Device Certificate

options.name: Server
options.description: X.509 Server Certificate

options.name: User
options.description: X.509 User Certificate
One of the following Certificate objects. Ignores any other value.

options.name: City
options.description: The City field for the certificate Subject DN. Specify a value when requesting a centrally generated CSR.

options.name: Contacts
options.description: An array of one or more identities for users or groups who receive notifications about events pertaining to the object

options.name: Country
options.description: The Country field for the certificate Subject DN. Specify a value when requesting a centrally generated CSR.

options.name: CreatedBy
options.description: The person, entity, or caller of this request. The default is Web SDK. Avoid overriding the default unless the caller is a significant enterprise application that is tightly integrated with Trust Protection Platform, such as a custom web portal. To add details, use Origin instead. If you want both attributes to have the same value, set only CreatedBy.

options.name: applications
options.description: An array of one or more Application objects to allow software, which runs on ObjectName, to use the same certificate

options.name: CloudInstanceID
options.description: Required for Amazon EC2 provisioning. The unique cloud instance ID.

options.name: CloudRegion
options.description: Required for Amazon EC2 provisioning. The geographic location where the cloud service instance resides. An instance in AWS can only exist in a single region.

options.name: CloudService
options.description: Required for Amazon EC2 provisioning. AWS: An Amazon E2C cloud service. Requires you to install and configure the Cloud Instance Monitoring feature.

options.name: ConcurrentConnectionLimit
options.description: Maximum number of connections the device will accept from Trust Protection Platform

options.name: Contacts
options.description: An array of one or more identities who receive notifications for this device

options.name: CreatedBy
options.description: The person or entity that is creating the device and any associated software applications for the device. Any value is accepted. Default is Web SDK.

options.name: CredentialDN
options.description: The device credential

options.name: description
options.description: The description for this device

options.name: EnforceKnownHost
options.description: For SSH keys. true: Enable known host key enforcement. false: Disable known host key enforcement.

options.name: host
options.description: The physical Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) for the host or the IP address for a device

options.name: ObjectName
options.description: The device host name or IP address for the certificate object in Trust Protection Platform. If the value is missing, the object name is the Subject.

options.name: port
options.description: The port number to communicate with the device

options.name: SudoCredentialDN
options.description: Use in conjunction with UseSudo. The DN that holds the password credential to be used if sudo is configured to prompt for a password when executing a command.

options.name: TempDirectory
options.description: The host directory path to hold temporary files during provisioning. For example /tmp/. The folder should have the necessary write permissions.

options.name: TrustedFingerprint
options.description: For Secure Shell (SSH) keys. The SSH server key fingerprint. If this value is set, and EnforceKnownHost is enabled, Trust Protection Platform will only successfully connect to the device if the hosts fingerprint matches this value.

options.name: UseSudo
options.description: Use in conjunction with SudoCredentialDN. For cases where the device credentials require sudo privilege elevation to execute commands when installing the certificate on a Unix or Linux device: true: Execute commands using sudo when provisioning. false: Execute commands directly without using sudo.

options.name: DisableAutomaticRenewal
options.description: The setting to control whether manual intervention is required for certificate renewal

options.name: EllipticCurve
P256
options.description: Use Elliptic Prime Curve 256 bit encryption

options.name: P384
options.description: Use Elliptic Prime Curve 384 bit encryption

options.name: P521
options.description: Use Elliptic Prime Curve 521 bit encryption. (not supported by all Certificate Authorities).
For Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC), use this parameter in conjunction with KeyAlgorithm

options.name: KeyAlgorithm
RSA
options.description: Rivest, Shamir, Adleman key (RSA)

options.name: ECC
options.description: Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC)
The encryption algorithm for the public ke:

options.name: KeyBitSize
options.description: Use this parameter when KeyAlgorithm is RSA. The number of bits to allow for key generation.

options.name: ManagementType
Enrollment
options.description: Issue a new certificate, renewcertificate, or key generation request to a CA for enrollment

options.name: Monitoring
options.description: Allow Trust Protection Platform to monitor the certificate for expiration and renewal

options.name: Provisioning
options.description: Issue a new certificate, renew a certificate, or send a key generation request to a CA for enrollment. Automatically install or provision the certificate.

options.name: Unassigned
options.description: Certificates are neither enrolled or monitored by Trust Protection Platform
The level of management that Trust Protection Platform applies to the certificate

options.name: origin
options.description: Additional information, such as the name and version of the calling application, that describes the source of this enrollment, renewal, or provisioning request. The default is Web SDK.

options.name: Organization
options.description: The Organization field for the certificate Subject DN. Specify a value when the CSR centrally generates.

options.name: OrganizationalUnit
options.description: The department or division within the organization that is responsible for maintaining the certificate

options.name: PKCS10
options.description: The PKCS#10 Certificate Signing Request (CSR). Omit escape characters such as or . If this value is provided, any Subject DN fields and the KeyBitSize in the request are ignored.

options.name: Reenable
options.description: The action to control a previously disabled certificate

options.name: SetWorkToDo
options.description: The setting to control certificate processing

options.name: State
options.description: The State field for the certificate Subject DN. Specify a value when requesting a centrally generated CSR.

values.name: Typename

options.name: OtherName
options.description: Specify a Uniform Resource Name (URN) or username

values.description: An integer that represents the kind of SAN

values.name: name
values.description: The SAN friendly name that corresponds to the Type or TypeName parameter. For example, if a TypeName is IPAddress, the Name value is a valid IP address.

properties.name: binaryProperty
properties.description: The name of the input field containing the binary file data to be uploaded

properties.name: certificateId
properties.description: A GUID that uniquely identifies the certificate

properties.name: returnAll
properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return

options.name: fields
options.description: Include one or more of the following certificate attributes in the return value

properties.name: certificateDN
properties.description: The Distinguished Name (DN) of the certificate to renew

options.name: PKCS10
options.description: The PKCS#10 Certificate Signing Request (CSR). Omit escape characters such as or . If this value is provided, any Subject DN fields and the KeyBitSize in the request are ignored.

options.name: Reenable
options.description: The action to control a previously disabled certificate

options.name: Get
options.description: Get a policy

properties.name: policyDn
properties.description: The Distinguished Name (DN) of the policy folder

options.name: PKCS10
options.description: The PKCS#10 policy Signing Request (CSR). Omit escape characters such as or . If this value is provided, any Subject DN fields and the KeyBitSize in the request are ignored.
